result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

email from Marathon County JA Br 1 re: scheduling
Status hearing on July 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Proposed Order for Consolidation of Cases and Exclusion of Inflammatory Evidence at Trial
Status hearing on July 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.

3:02 PM 
Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Casey J Schoenrock in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Casey J Schoenrock.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 20CF136, 22CF66, 21CF423.
ADA Mutchler states appearances.
ADA Mutchler notes this matter is set to address motions.
ADA Mutchler makes arguments and asks that the motions be granted.
Atty Renc makes arguments in opposition to the motions.
Court makes statements in response to argument made by Atty Renc. 
Court questions ADA Mutchler regarding the other acts motion.

Court addresses the motion for joinder.

BY THE COURT:
Motion for joinder is granted.
Testimony regarding certain acts, as noted on record, will not be admitted.

Atty Renc inquires as to the other acts evidence motion.
ADA Mutchler makes further statements in favor of the motion.

BY THE COURT:
State to draft a written order regarding the motion for other acts evidence for review by Atty Renc.

Atty Renc requests a status conference be scheduled once a new judge is appointed to the case.

Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
State's Jury Trial Witness List (sent to Br 2 JA on 03/24/22 sp)
Status conference on June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Joinder and Brief in Support of Joinder (sent to Br 2 JA on 03/01/22 sp)
Pre-trial conference on March 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant did not receive the information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.

01:12 PM Defendant Casey J Schoenrock in court with Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Atty Cassidy addresses the Court.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Defense will waive preliminary hearing.

Court does not see the information in the case.
Atty Cassidy replies, mirrors the criminal complaint. 

Atty Renc will go forward.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No direct or indirect contact with the victim, A.S., unless it is allowed with a family court order after February 14, 2022

01:27 PM Defendant Casey J Schoenrock in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies the address.
Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Defendant is informed of his right to be represented by counsel.
Defendant is informed to go to the public defender's office to see if he is eligible for their representation.
If not eligible he can then file a petition for a court appointed attorney.
Defendant states that he currently has Atty Anne Renc representing him.
Defendant is to contact the public defender's office to get Atty Renc appointed to this case.
State is requesting a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record.
State does not object to the adjournment.

BY THE COURT:
Case is adjourned.
Bond is set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial Appearance set for February 14, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2
